title: Growth of superconducting single-crystalline (Lu, Ca)Ba2Cu3O7-d whiskers

title_detail.value: Growth of superconducting single-crystalline (Lu, Ca)Ba2Cu3O7-d whiskers

summary:
Single-crystalline (Lu, Ca)Ba2Cu3O7-d (Lu(Ca)123) whiskers have been
successfully grown using the Te-doping method. X-ray diffraction patterns of
Lu(Ca)123 whiskers showed sharp (0 0 l) peaks corresponding to REBa2Cu3O7-d
phase (RE = rare earth elements). Transport measurements showed that the
superconducting transition occurred at 83 K in the obtained whiskers.

successfully grown using the Te-doping method. X-ray diffraction patterns of
Lu(Ca)123 whiskers showed sharp (0 0 l) peaks corresponding to REBa2Cu3O7-d
phase (RE = rare earth elements). Transport measurements showed that the
superconducting transition occurred at 83 K in the obtained whiskers.

author: Y. Takano

Abstract
Single-crystalline (Lu, Ca)Ba2Cu3O7-δ (Lu(Ca)123) whiskers have been successfully
grown using the Te-doping method. X-ray diffraction patterns of Lu(Ca)123 whiskers
showed sharp (0 0 l) peaks corresponding to REBa2Cu3O7-δ phase (RE = rare earth
elements). Transport measurements showed that the superconducting transition
occurred at 83 K in the obtained whiskers.
Keywords: Superconductivity, Whisker, RE123, Lutetium

LuBa2Cu3O7-δ (Lu123) whiskers.
